document_title: Pneumoconiosis (dust in the lungs): Causes, signs and treatments
subsection_name: bui-phoi.json_2_Causes dust to enter the lungs
subsection_content:
The main cause of dust in the lungs is due to patients coming into contact with materials that are capable of dispersing very small particles and entering the lungs. There are many types of dust, the most common of which are asbestos, coal dust and most commonly silica.
Silicon is found in sand, sandstone, granite, slate, metals and coal ores. Silicosis usually forms and progresses slowly, usually occurring about 5-10 years after the patient is exposed to this type of dust.
subsection_title: bui phoi.json. Causes dust to enter the lungs
